title: The Further Adventures of Sherlock Holmes - BBC Radio - Set 7 -
description:
The Further Adventures of Sherlock Holmes by Bert Coules.

Based on the characters created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

Starring Clive Merrison as Sherlock Holmes & Andrew Sachs as Doctor John Watson.

Following the success of the complete canon, the BBC commissioned Bert Coules to write a new series of original stories.

It was decided to base the episodes on Doyle&#039;s tantalising throwaway references to other cases, which he scattered throughout the fifty-six short stories and four novels. A mixture of well-known and more obscure "unrecorded cases" was selected.

The shows were initially planned to star the original team of Clive Merrison and Michael Williams, but Williams&#039; untimely death meant that it was not to be.

Two series, each with five 45-minute episodes. Total running time approximately 7Ã‚Â½ hours.

Series One (Broadcast 2002)

The Madness of Colonel Warburton

The Star of the Adelphi

The Peculiar Persecution of Mr John Vincent Harden

The Singular Inheritance of Miss Gloria Wilson

The Saviour of Cripplegate Square.


Series Two (Broadcast 2004)

The Abergavenny Murder

The Shameful Betrayal of Miss Emily Smith

The Tragedy of Hanbury Street

The Determind Client

The Striking Success of Miss Franny Blossom.

My recordings from BBC7 at 128kbps ABR joint-stereo mp3, encoded with LAME.
Recorded from Freeview -> DVD Recorder -> MP3.

Have fun & please seed.
